abstract: Citigroup expected to sell the music company for $4 billion. But with fewer banks willing to finance bids, offers are said to be substantially less.
snippet: Citigroup expected to sell the music company for $4 billion. But with fewer banks willing to finance bids, offers are said to be substantially less.
lead_paragraph: When the Warner Music Group, the home of Neil Young and Green Day, was sold in May for $3.3 billion, music executives and media analysts were pleasantly surprised. The higher-than-expected price, after a frothy auction that drew as many as 20 suitors, seemed to indicate an enduring faith in music as an investment after a decade of bad news.

headline.main: Bids to Buy Citigroup’s EMI Group Are Said to Fall Short of Expectations
headline.print_headline: Bids to Buy Citigroup’s EMI Group Are Said to Fall Short of Expectations
